img.alt: Eagle Academy Public Charter School-Update 4-21-20 Featured Photo

div.div:
Eagle Academy PCS wishes good health to all students, parents, and staff during this difficult time. The pandemic will challenge the entire school body to implement safe practices everyday i.e. social distancing, ensuring hands are washing, and staying indoors as much as possible.
Per the mayor’s announcement Eagle Academy will follow the recommendation and stay closed and conduct distance virtual learning through June 21St.

img.alt: Parent technical support...And Who to Contact with Questions Featured Photo

h3.a: Parent technical support...And Who to Contact with Questions
As D.C. students struggle to get online, schools and parents rush to fill the void
Distance Virtual Learning continues through June 12
Distance Virtual Learning continues through June 12
Distance Virtual Learning continues through June 12
Distance Virtual Learning continues through June 12

div.div: Eagle Academy founder, Cassandra S. Pinkney, passed away on September 30, 2016, but her legacy will live on through the school she left behind. Known for her unwavering dedication and love for children, Cassandra spent four decades educating and advocating for underprivileged students.

Starting her career in education as a preschool teacher, she too often came face-to-face with the grim reality that children did not always receive the services they needed to succeed. In 2003, she partnered with Dr. Joe Smith to start Eagle Academy, the first exclusively early childhood public charter school in DC. Cassandra's legacy and passion for providing high-quality programs to low-income students is reflected in Eagle Academy, and it is our hope to continue her life's work for years to come.

Through the creation of the Cassandra S. Pinkney Foundation, we will expand on Cassandra's vision to ensure every child has the opportunity to succeed. With a focus on "exposure," we intend to introduce our students to the possibilities of their futures.
